20#include "BitArray.h"
21#include "DecodeStatus.h"

24#include <algorithm>

30
31/*
32Code39 : 1:2/3, 5+4+1 (0x3|2x1 wide) -> 12-15 mods, v1-? | ToNarrowWide(OMG 1) == *
33Codabar: 1:2/3, 4+3+1 (1x1|1x2|3x0 wide) -> 9-13 mods, v1-? | ToNarrowWide(OMG 2) == ABCD
34ITF : 1:2/3, 5+5 (2x2 wide) -> mods, v6-?| .5, .38 == * | qz:10
35
36Code93 : 1-4, 3+3 -> 9 mods v1-? | round to 1-4 == *
37Code128: 1-4, 3+3 -> 11 mods v1-? | .7, .25 == ABC | qz:10
38UPC/EAN: 1-4, 2+2 -> 7 mods f | .7, .48 == *
39 UPC-A: 11d 95m = 3 + 6*4 + 5 + 6*4 + 3 = 59
40 EAN-13: 12d 95m
41
42RSS14 : 1-8, finder: (15,2+3), symbol: (15/16,4+4) | .45, .2 (finder only), 14d
43 code = 2xguard + 2xfinder + 4xsymbol = (96,23), stacked = 2x50 mods
44RSSExp.: v?-74d/?-41c
45*/
46
47namespace ZXing {
48
49class Result;
50
51namespace OneD {
52
53/**
54* Encapsulates functionality and implementation that is common to all families
55* of one-dimensional barcodes.
56*
57* @author dswitkin@google.com (Daniel Switkin)
58* @author Sean Owen
59*/
60class RowReader
61{
62public:
63
64 struct DecodingState
65 {
66 virtual ~DecodingState() = default;
67 };
68
69 Result decodeSingleRow(int rowNumber, const BitArray& row) const;
70
71 virtual ~RowReader() {}
72
73 /**
74 * <p>Attempts to decode a one-dimensional barcode format given a single row of
75 * an image.</p>
76 *
77 * @param rowNumber row number from top of the row
78 * @param row the black/white pixel data of the row
79 * @param hints decode hints
80 * @return {@link Result} containing encoded string and start/end of barcode
81 * @throws NotFoundException if no potential barcode is found
82 * @throws ChecksumException if a potential barcode is found but does not pass its checksum
83 * @throws FormatException if a potential barcode is found but format is invalid
84 */
85 virtual Result decodeRow(int rowNumber, const BitArray& row, std::unique_ptr<DecodingState>& state) const = 0;
86
87 virtual Result decodePattern(int rowNumber, const PatternView& row, std::unique_ptr<DecodingState>& state) const;
88
89 /**
90 * Scans the given bit range for a pattern identified by evaluating the function object match for each
91 * successive run of counters.size() bars. If the pattern is found, it returns the bit range with the
92 * pattern. Otherwise an empty range is returned.
93 *
94 * @param begin/end bit range to scan for pattern
95 * @param counters array into which to record counts
96 * @param match predicate that gets evaluated to identify the pattern
97 * @throws NotFoundException if counters cannot be filled entirely from row before running out
98 * of pixels
99 */
100 template <typename Iterator, typename Container, typename Predicate>
101 static Range<Iterator> FindPattern(Iterator begin, Iterator end, Container& counters, Predicate match) {
102 if (begin == end)
103 return {end, end};
104
105 Iterator li = begin, i = begin;
106 auto currentCounter = counters.begin();
107 typedef typename std::decay<decltype(*currentCounter)>::type CounterValue;
108 while ((i = BitArray::getNextSetTo(i, end, !*i)) != end) {
109 *currentCounter = static_cast<CounterValue>(i - li);
110 if (++currentCounter == counters.end()) {
111 if (match(begin, i, counters)) {
112 return {begin, i};
113 }
114 std::advance(begin, counters[0] + counters[1]);
115 std::copy(counters.begin() + 2, counters.end(), counters.begin());
116 std::advance(currentCounter, -2);
117 }
118 li = i;
119 }
120 // if we ran into the end, still set the currentCounter. see RecordPattern.
121 *currentCounter = static_cast<CounterValue>(i - li);
122
123 return {end, end};
124 }
125
126 /**
127 * Records the size of successive runs of white and black pixels in a row, starting at a given point.
128 * The values are recorded in the given array, and the number of runs recorded is equal to the size
129 * of the array. If the row starts on a white pixel at the given start point, then the first count
130 * recorded is the run of white pixels starting from that point; likewise it is the count of a run
131 * of black pixels if the row begin on a black pixels at that point.
132 *
133 * @param row row to count from
134 * @param start offset into row to start at
135 * @param counters array into which to record counts
136 * @throws NotFoundException if counters cannot be filled entirely from row before running out
137 * of pixels
138 */
139 template <typename Iterator, typename Container>
140 static Range<Iterator> RecordPattern(Iterator begin, Iterator end, Container& counters) {
141 // mark the last counter-slot as empty
142 counters.back() = 0;
143
144 auto range = FindPattern(begin, end, counters, [](Iterator, Iterator, Container&) { return true; });
145
146 // If we reached the end iterator but touched the last counter-slot, we accept the result.
147 if (range.end == end && counters.back() != 0)
148 return {begin, end};
149 else
150 return range;
151 }
152
153 template <typename Iterator, typename Container>
154 static Range<Iterator> RecordPatternInReverse(Iterator begin, Iterator end, Container& counters) {
155 std::reverse_iterator<Iterator> rbegin(end), rend(begin);
156 auto range = RecordPattern(rbegin, rend, counters);
157 std::reverse(counters.begin(), counters.end());
158 return {range.end.base(), range.begin.base()};
159 }
160
161 /**
162 * Determines how closely a set of observed counts of runs of black/white values matches a given
163 * target pattern. This is reported as the ratio of the total variance from the expected pattern
164 * proportions across all pattern elements, to the length of the pattern.
165 *
166 * @param counters observed counters
167 * @param pattern expected pattern
168 * @param maxIndividualVariance The most any counter can differ before we give up
169 * @return ratio of total variance between counters and pattern compared to total pattern size
170 */
171 template <typename CP, typename PP>
172 static float PatternMatchVariance(const CP* counters, const PP* pattern, size_t length, float maxIndividualVariance)
173 {
174 int total = std::accumulate(counters, counters+length, 0);
175 int patternLength = std::accumulate(pattern, pattern+length, 0);
176 if (total < patternLength) {
177 // If we don't even have one pixel per unit of bar width, assume this is too small
178 // to reliably match, so fail:
179 return std::numeric_limits<float>::max();
180 }
181
182 float unitBarWidth = (float)total / patternLength;
183 maxIndividualVariance *= unitBarWidth;
184
185 float totalVariance = 0.0f;
186 for (size_t x = 0; x < length; ++x) {
187 float variance = std::abs(counters[x] - pattern[x] * unitBarWidth);
188 if (variance > maxIndividualVariance) {
189 return std::numeric_limits<float>::max();
190 }
191 totalVariance += variance;
192 }
193 return totalVariance / total;
194 }
195
196 template <typename Counters, typename Pattern>
197 static float PatternMatchVariance(const Counters& counters, const Pattern& pattern, float maxIndividualVariance) {
198 assert(Size(counters) <= Size(pattern)); //TODO: this should test for equality, see ODCode128Reader.cpp:93
199 return PatternMatchVariance(counters.data(), pattern.data(), counters.size(), maxIndividualVariance);
200 }
201
202 /**
203 * Attempts to decode a sequence of black/white lines into single
204 * digit.
205 *
206 * @param counters the counts of runs of observed black/white/black/... values
207 * @param patterns the list of patterns to compare the contens of counters to
208 * @param requireUnambiguousMatch the 'best match' must be better than all other matches
209 * @return The decoded digit index, -1 if no pattern matched
210 */
211 template <typename Counters, typename Patterns>
212 static int DecodeDigit(const Counters& counters, const Patterns& patterns, float maxAvgVariance,
213 float maxIndividualVariance, bool requireUnambiguousMatch = true)
214 {
215 float bestVariance = maxAvgVariance; // worst variance we'll accept
216 constexpr int INVALID_MATCH = -1;
217 int bestMatch = INVALID_MATCH;
218 for (size_t i = 0; i < patterns.size(); i++) {
219 float variance = PatternMatchVariance(counters, patterns[i], maxIndividualVariance);
220 if (variance < bestVariance) {
221 bestVariance = variance;
222 bestMatch = static_cast<int>(i);
223 } else if (requireUnambiguousMatch && variance == bestVariance) {
224 // if we find a second 'best match' with the same variance, we can not reliably report to have a suitable match
225 bestMatch = INVALID_MATCH;
226 }
227 }
228 return bestMatch;
229 }
230
231 /**
232 * @brief NarrowWideThreshold calculates width thresholds to separate narrow and wide bars and spaces.
233 *
234 * This is useful for codes like Codabar, Code39 and ITF which distinguish between narrow and wide
235 * bars/spaces. Where wide ones are between 2 and 3 times as wide as the narrow ones.
236 *
237 * @param view containing one character
238 * @return threshold value for bars and spaces
239 */
240 static BarAndSpaceI NarrowWideThreshold(const PatternView& view)
241 {
242 BarAndSpaceI m = {std::numeric_limits<BarAndSpaceI::value_type>::max(),
243 std::numeric_limits<BarAndSpaceI::value_type>::max()};
244 BarAndSpaceI M = {0, 0};
245 for (int i = 0; i < view.size(); ++i) {
246 m[i] = std::min(m[i], view[i]);
247 M[i] = std::max(M[i], view[i]);
248 }
249
250 BarAndSpaceI res;
251 for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
252 // check that
253 // a) wide <= 4 * narrow
254 // b) bars and spaces are not more than a factor of 2 (or 3 for the max) apart from each other
255 if (M[i] > 4 * (m[i] + 1) || M[i] > 3 * M[i + 1] || m[i] > 2 * (m[i + 1] + 1))
256 return {};
257 // the threshold is the average of min and max but at least 1.5 * min
258 res[i] = std::max((m[i] + M[i]) / 2, m[i] * 3 / 2);
259 }
260
261 return res;
262 }
263
264 /**
265 * @brief ToNarrowWidePattern takes a PatternView, calculates a NarrowWideThreshold and returns int where a '0' bit
266 * means narrow and a '1' bit means 'wide'.
267 */
268 static int NarrowWideBitPattern(const PatternView& view)
269 {
270 const auto threshold = NarrowWideThreshold(view);
271 if (!threshold.isValid())
272 return -1;
273
274 int pattern = 0;
275 for (int i = 0; i < view.size(); ++i) {
276 if (view[i] > threshold[i] * 2)
277 return -1;
278 pattern = (pattern << 1) | (view[i] > threshold[i]);
279 }
280
281 return pattern;
282 }
283
284 /**
285 * @brief each bar/space is 1-4 modules wide, we have N bars/spaces, they are SUM modules wide in total
286 */
287 template <int LEN, int SUM>
288 static int OneToFourBitPattern(const PatternView& view)
289 {
290 float moduleSize = static_cast<float>(view.sum(LEN)) / SUM;
291 int err = SUM;
292 int is[LEN];
293 float rs[LEN];
294 for (int i = 0; i < LEN; i++) {
295 float v = view[i] / moduleSize;
296 is[i] = int(v + .5f);
297 rs[i] = v - is[i];
298 err -= is[i];
299 }
300
301 if (std::abs(err) > 1)
302 return -1;
303
304 if (err) {
305 int mi = err > 0 ? std::max_element(std::begin(rs), std::end(rs)) - std::begin(rs)
306 : std::min_element(std::begin(rs), std::end(rs)) - std::begin(rs);
307 is[mi] += err;
308 rs[mi] -= err;
309 }
310
311 int pattern = 0;
312 for (size_t i = 0; i < LEN; i++)
313 pattern = (pattern << is[i]) | ~(0xffffffff << is[i]) * (~i & 1);
314
315 return pattern;
316 }
317
318 template<typename INDEX, typename ALPHABET>
319 static char LookupBitPattern(int pattern, const INDEX& table, const ALPHABET& alphabet)
320 {
321 int i = IndexOf(table, pattern);
322 return i == -1 ? -1 : alphabet[i];
323 }
324
325 template<typename INDEX, typename ALPHABET>
326 static char DecodeNarrowWidePattern(const PatternView& view, const INDEX& table, const ALPHABET& alphabet)
327 {
328 return LookupBitPattern(NarrowWideBitPattern(view), table, alphabet);
329 }
330};
331
332} // OneD
333} // ZXing
